# withUnsafePointerToVImageBuffer(_:)

**Instance Method**

Calls the given closure with an unsafe pointer to the underlying vImage buffer.

## Declaration

```swift
func withUnsafePointerToVImageBuffer<R>(_ body: (UnsafePointer<vImage_Buffer>) throws -> R) rethrows -> R
```

## Parameters

- **body**: A closure with an unsafe pointer to a [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/vImage_Buffer] parameter that points to the underlying vImage buffer of the pixel buffer.

## Return Value

The return value, if any, of the body closure parameter.

## Discussion

Use this function to incorporate pixel buffer based image processing code with existing vImage code. For example, the following code passes a pixel buffer to the C API [doc://com.apple.accelerate/documentation/Accelerate/vImageBufferFill_ARGB8888(_:_:_:)] routine:

```swift
 let src = vImage.PixelBuffer<vImage.Interleaved8x4>(size: vImage.Size(width: 128, height: 128))

 src.withUnsafePointerToVImageBuffer { vImageBufferPtr in
     _ = vImageBufferFill_ARGB8888(vImageBufferPtr,
                                   [0, 0, 0, 0],
                                   vImage_Flags(kvImageNoFlags))
 }
```

## Accessing underlying vImage buffers

- **withUnsafeVImageBuffer(_:)**: Calls the given closure with the underlying vImage buffer.
- **withUnsafeVImageBuffers(_:)**: Calls the given closure with the underlying vImage buffers.
